verses.verse: After <WH310> this Job <WH347> opened <WH6605> his mouth, <WH6310> and cursed <WH7043> the day of his birth. <WH3117>
Then Job <WH347> answered <WH6030> and said: <WH559>
"Let the day <WH3117> perish <WH6> in which I was born, <WH3205> the night <WH3915> which said, <WH559> <WH1397> 'There is a boy conceived. <WH2029>'
Let that day <WH3117> be darkness. <WH2822> Don't <WH433> let God from above <WH4605> seek <WH1875> for it, <WH5105> neither let the light shine on it. <WH3313>

Let darkness <WH2822> and the shadow of death <WH6757> claim <WH1350> it for their own. <WH6053> Let a cloud dwell <WH7931> on it. <WH3650> Let all that makes black the day <WH3117> terrify it. <WH1204>

As for that night, <WH3915> let thick darkness <WH652> seize <WH3947> on it. <WH2302> Let it not rejoice among the days <WH3117> of the year. <WH8141> Let it not come <WH935> into the number <WH4557> of the months. <WH3391>
Behold, <WH3915> let that night be barren. <WH1565> Let no joyful voice <WH7445> come therein. <WH935>
Let them curse <WH5344> it who curse <WH779> the day, <WH3117> who are ready <WH6264> to rouse up <WH5782> leviathan. <WH3882>
Let the stars <WH3556> of its twilight <WH5399> be dark. <WH2821> Let it look <WH6960> for light, <WH216> but have none, <WH7200> neither let it see the eyelids <WH6079> of the morning, <WH7837>
because it didn't <WH5462> shut up the doors <WH1817> of my mother <WH990>'s womb, nor did it hide <WH5641> trouble <WH5999> from my eyes. <WH5869>
"Why didn't <WH4191> I die from the womb? <WH7358> Why didn't <WH1478> I give up the spirit when my mother <WH990> bore me? <WH3318>
Why did the knees <WH1290> receive <WH6923> me? <WH7699> Or why the breast, that I should nurse? <WH3243>
For now should I have lain down <WH7901> and been quiet. <WH8252> I should have slept, <WH3462> then I would have been at rest, <WH5117>
with kings <WH4428> and counselors <WH3289> of the earth, <WH776> who built <WH1129> up waste places for themselves; <WH2723>
or with princes <WH8269> who had gold, <WH2091> who filled <WH4390> their houses <WH1004> with silver: <WH3701>
or as a hidden <WH2934> untimely birth <WH5309> I had not been, <WH5768> as infants who never saw <WH7200> light. <WH216>
There the wicked <WH7563> cease <WH2308> from troubling. <WH7267> There the weary <WH3019> are at rest. <WH5117>
There the prisoners <WH615> are at ease <WH7599> together. <WH3162> They don't <WH8085> hear the voice <WH6963> of the taskmaster. <WH5065>
The small <WH6996> and the great <WH1419> are there. <WH5650> The servant is free <WH2670> from his master. <WH113>
"Why is light <WH216> given <WH5414> to him who is in misery, <WH6001> life <WH2416> to the bitter <WH4751> in soul, <WH5315>
Who long <WH2442> for death, <WH4194> but it doesn't <WH2658> come; and dig for it more than for hidden treasures, <WH4301>
who rejoice <WH8056> exceedingly, <WH1524> and are glad, <WH7797> when they can find <WH4672> the grave? <WH6913>
Why is light given to a man <WH1397> whose way <WH1870> is hidden, <WH5641> whom God <WH433> has hedged in? <WH5526>
For my sighing <WH585> comes <WH935> before <WH6440> I eat. <WH3899> My groanings <WH7581> are poured out <WH5413> like water. <WH4325>
For the thing which I fear <WH6342> comes <WH857> on me, <WH3025> That which I am afraid of comes to me. <WH935>
I am not at ease, <WH8252> neither am I quiet, <WH8252> neither have I rest; <WH8252> but trouble <WH7267> comes. <WH935>"
